items.title: Scotland progress in Women's T20 World Cup qualifiers
items.summary: Scotland proceed to the Women's T20 World Cup qualifier Super 6 stage with a fourth group win out of five after defeating hosts Nepal by 72 runs.

items.title: Woods comparisons continue after Scheffler wins again

items.title: Warriors win 'bizarre, sad' game in Minnesota after ICE shooting
items.summary: Steve Kerr says the Golden State Warriors' win at the Minnesota Timberwolves took place in a "sombre atmosphere" after the fatal shooting of an intensive care nurse by immigration agents in Minneapolis.

items.title: Redmi Turbo 5 and Turbo 5 Max launch date set
items.summary: Redmi has finally set a launch date for its upcoming Turbo 5 series smartphones in China. The company also showcased the Turbo 5 Max in an orange color option and revealed some design details. In a Weibo post, Redmi confirmed that the Turbo 5 and Turbo 5 Max will debut in China on January 29. Alongâ€¦

items.title: Man Utd have taken step towards winning formula - Rooney
items.summary: Manchester United have taken a "step" towards getting back to where they were during their glory days, says Wayne Rooney.

items.title: How family grief made Hamer-Webb pick Wales over England
items.summary: Uncapped Gabriel Hamer-Webb reveals how his Cardiff-born mother urged him to pick Wales over England for his international future.

items.title: Seahawks to face Patriots in Super Bowl 60

items.title: Villa's attackers are 'handful to play against' - Murphy
items.summary: Match of The Day pundit Danny Murphy praises Aston Villa's front four for their "well-coached" play that broke down Newcastle.

items.title: 'Another unbelievable result' - but what's different about Man Utd now?
items.summary: MOTD pundit Danny Murphy explains how Manchester United earned their impressive win at Premier League leaders Arsenal, and how he feels the Gunners will react.

items.title: Hardly anyone would have picked Carrick to be Man Utd boss - but now?
items.summary: As Michael Carrick's perfect start at Manchester United continues, is he building a case for the job longer term?

items.title: So many positives to take - Carrick
items.summary: Manchester United manager Michael Carrick says he is "so proud" of his side and there are "many positives to take" after they beat Mikel Arteta's Arsenal 3-2 at the Emirates Stadium.

items.title: Why can't Newcastle win without Guimaraes?
items.summary: Newcastle United have yet to win a league game without Bruno Guimaraes since he made his debut for the club in 2022.

items.title: 'They're engaged' - Rosenior continues positive start at Chelsea
items.summary: Liam Rosenior has started well at Chelsea and it bodes well for the future amid ambitions to qualify for the Champions League.

items.title: Cunha scores stunning late winner as Man Utd beat Arsenal
items.summary: Two sensational second-half strikes give Manchester United a huge win that takes them above Chelsea and Liverpool into fourth.

items.title: Buendia scores screamer as Villa beat Newcastle
items.summary: Emiliano Buendia and Ollie Watkins both score as high-flying Aston Villa end their long wait for a St James' Park victory against Newcastle United.

items.title: Estevao-inspired Chelsea beat Crystal Palace
items.summary: Estevao Willian replaces the injured Cole Palmer to inspire Chelsea to a comfortable win over Crystal Palace at Selhurst Park.

items.title: Forest boost survival hopes after win at Brentford
items.summary: Nottingham Forest gave their hopes of Premier League survival a major boost with a hard-fought win against Brentford at Gtech Community Stadium.

items.title: 'There's no magician' - can Palace stop the slide?
items.summary: After a torrid few weeks with captain Marc Guehi sold, manager Oliver Glasner confirming he will leave and striker Jean-Philippe Mateta wanting a transfer, are Crystal Palace's struggles on the field inevitable?

items.title: 'Intoxicating title fight impossible to call as Hearts refuse to buckle'
items.summary: Depleted Scottish Premiership leaders Hearts passed the latest test of their mettle in compelling draw with Celtic, writes Tom English.

items.title: Dublin-born Brennan added to France squad for Ireland opener
items.summary: Dublin-born Joshua Brennan is called into the France squad for their Six Nations opener against Ireland in Paris on 5 February.

items.title: Emery 'so happy' with 'extraordinary' Villa performance
items.summary: Unai Emery is "so happy" with his side's "extraordinary" 2-0 win at Newcastle, emphasising the visitors' "fantastic attitude" and "commitment to defence."

items.title: Leicester sack Cifuentes after six months as boss
items.summary: Marti Cifuentes is sacked as Leicester City manager after just six months in charge with the Foxes in the bottom half of the Championship.

items.title: Man City 'got job done' - so is WSL title race over?
items.summary: Manchester City capitalised on Chelsea's defeat to open up a nine-point lead at the top of the Women's Super League. Is the title race over?

items.title: Horner part of group interested in Alpine stake

items.title: Sabalenka sets tie-break record to reach last eight

items.title: Modder turns RTX 2080 Ti Hall of Fame into a supercharged 900W Titan RTX with transplanted core and memory â€” fully unlocked TU102 die with a 900W power limit hits 18k on 3DMark TimeSpy Extreme
items.summary: RTX 2080 Ti Hall of Fame graphics card gets transplanted with a Titan RTX core and 24GB of GDDR6 memory. Paired with a 900W power limit modification, the card achieved a TimeSpy Extreme score better than an RTX 3090 on air.

items.title: Gaming PC charges you quarters every time you want to power it on, restoring oldest form of microtransactions â€” $135 in tools and supplies, plus a lifetime supply of quarters to kick it old school
items.summary: A YouTube engineer has built a coin-operated power switch for a gaming PC, allowing users to pay for the privilege of turning on their own PC's â€” which is unfortunately not a cry too distant from encroaching reality.

items.title: Enthusiast strips GPU cooler to run sub-zero water through its heatpipes, drops temps to 13C â€” Modded, liquid-cooled RTX 2060 maintains 13C in gaming & unlocks higher boost clocks
items.summary: A GPU running ice-cold water through its heatpipes without being a part of a massive liquid-nitrogen-fueled overclocking session is not something you see every day. That's exactly what TrashBench did by cutting up an RTX 2060's heatsink and attaching his own tubes to the cooler to push sub-zero liqâ€¦
